title: Workflow Configuration
description: Schema defining the structure of a workflow configuration including name, target URL, color mode, and flow steps.

name.title: Workflow Name
name.description: Name of your workflow. Symphony will display the name when running the workflow.

url.title: Target Website URL
url.description: Target website URL where this workflow will be executed. This determines the starting page for all automation steps in the flow.

colorMode.title: Color Mode
colorMode.description: Preferred color scheme for the target website during workflow execution. Set to 'light' or 'dark' to ensure consistent UI appearance across different systems. Defaults to 'light' if not specified.

flow.title: Workflow Flow Steps
flow.description: Ordered sequence of browser automation steps (clicks, inputs, scrolling, keyboard actions, waits, etc.) that define the complete workflow execution path.

anyOf.title: Input Action
anyOf.description: Defines an input action where a value is entered into a specified input field identified by the `selector`, `label`, `testID`, `placeholder` or `role` .

input.title: Input Action
input.description: Defines an input action where a value is entered into a specified input field identified by the `selector`, `label`, `testID`, `placeholder` or `role` .

selector.markdownDescription:
Selector to identify the input field. Supports multiple locator strategies.

---

**Label Locator** â€” `label:`  
Locates input elements by the text of the associated `<label>` or `aria-labelledby` element, or by the `aria-label` attribute.

**Usage:** `label:Username`, `label:Email Address`

**Example DOM:**
```html
<input aria-label="Username">
<label for="email-input">Email Address:</label>
<input id="email-input">
```

---

**Test ID Locator** â€” `testID:`  
Locates elements by their `data-testid` attribute. Recommended for reliable test automation.

**Usage:** `testID:login-input`, `testID:search-field`

**Example DOM:**
```html
<input data-testid="login-input" type="text">
<input data-testid="search-field" placeholder="Search...">
```

---

**Placeholder Locator** â€” `placeholder:`  
Locates input elements by their `placeholder` attribute text.

**Usage:** `placeholder:Enter your email`, `placeholder:Search...`

**Example DOM:**
```html
<input placeholder="Enter your email" type="email">
<input placeholder="Search..." type="search">
```

---

**Role Locator** â€” `role:`  
Locates elements by their ARIA role and optional accessible name.

**Usage:** `role:textbox name="username"`, `role:searchbox`

**Example DOM:**
```html
<input role="textbox" aria-label="username">
<input role="searchbox" placeholder="Search products">
```

---

**CSS Selector** â€” Direct CSS selector  
Standard CSS selector syntax for precise element targeting.

**Usage:** `#username`, `.form-input`, `input[name="email"]`

**Example DOM:**
```html
<input id="username" type="text">
<input class="form-input" name="email">
```

---

Semantic locators (**label**, **testID**, **placeholder**, **role**) are recommended as they make tests more maintainable and align with accessibility best practices.

anyOf.title: ClickOn Action
anyOf.description: Defines a click action that can target elements either by CSS selector or by visible text content.

clickOn.title: ClickOn Action
clickOn.description: Defines a click action that can target elements either by CSS selector or by visible text content.

selector.markdownDescription:
CSS selector to identify the clickable element.

**Usage**  
Standard CSS selector syntax to target specific elements for clicking.

**Examples**
- `#submit-btn` â€” Click element with ID 'submit-btn'
- `.nav-link` â€” Click element with class 'nav-link'
- `button[type="submit"]` â€” Click submit button
- `a[href="/login"]` â€” Click link with specific href
- `[data-testid="confirm-button"]` â€” Click element with test ID

**Common Use Cases**
```yaml
- clickOn:
    selector: "#login-button"  # Click login button by ID
```

```yaml
- clickOn:
    selector: ".modal-close"   # Click modal close button
```

```yaml
- clickOn:
    selector: 'button[type="submit"]'  # Click form submit button
```

anyOf.markdownDescription: Text content of the element to click. **Usage** Clicks on elements containing the specified visible text content. **Examples with HTML** - `"Login"` â€” Clicks elements like `` or `Login` - `"Submit"` â€” Clicks elements like `` or `` - `"Add to Cart"` â€” Clicks elements like `` - `"Sign Up"` â€” Clicks elements like `Sign Up` **Common Use Cases** ```yaml - clickOn: "Login" # Click any element containing "Login" text ``` ```yaml - clickOn: "Add to Cart" # Click button with "Add to Cart" text ``` ```yaml - clickOn: "Next" # Click element containing "Next" text ``` **Note:** If multiple elements contain the same text, only the first occurrence will be clicked. For precise targeting, use CSS selectors instead.

anyOf.title: WaitFor Action
anyOf.description: Defines a wait action that pauses workflow execution for a specified duration in milliseconds.

waitFor.title: WaitFor Action
waitFor.description: Defines a wait action that pauses workflow execution for a specified duration in milliseconds.

duration.markdownDescription:
Duration in milliseconds to pause execution.

**Usage**  
Pauses the workflow execution for the specified time period. Useful for:
- Waiting for animations to complete
- Allowing page content to load
- Adding delays between rapid actions
- Ensuring UI stability before next step

**Examples**
- `1000` â€” Wait for 1 second
- `500` â€” Wait for 0.5 seconds
- `3000` â€” Wait for 3 seconds
- `100` â€” Wait for 0.1 seconds

**Common Use Cases**
```yaml
- waitFor:
    duration: 2000  # Wait 2 seconds for page to load
```

```yaml
- waitFor:
    duration: 500   # Brief pause after form submission
```

anyOf.title: Keyboard Action
anyOf.description: Defines a keyboard action that simulates key presses on the webpage.

keyboard.title: Keyboard Action
keyboard.description: Defines a keyboard action that simulates key presses on the webpage.

key.markdownDescription:
**Keyboard key or key combination.**

Supports single keys like `Enter`, `KeyA`, or `ArrowUp`, and combinations joined by `+` such as `Control+Enter`, `Shift+Alt+KeyS`, or `ControlOrMeta+KeyC`.

**Categories of valid keys:**

- **Modifier Keys** â€” `Shift`, `Control`, `Alt`, `Meta`, `ControlOrMeta`
- **Alphabetic Keys** â€” `KeyA` to `KeyZ`
- **Digit Keys** â€” `Digit0` to `Digit9`
- **Function Keys** â€” `F1` to `F12`
- **Keypad Keys** â€” `Numpad0` to `Numpad9`, `NumpadAdd`, `NumpadEnter`, etc.
- **Arrow Keys** â€” `ArrowUp`, `ArrowDown`, `ArrowLeft`, `ArrowRight`
- **Editing Keys** â€” `Backspace`, `Enter`, `Tab`, `Delete`, `Escape`, `Space`, `Insert`
- **Navigation Keys** â€” `Home`, `End`, `PageUp`, `PageDown`
- **Symbol Keys** â€” `Minus`, `Equal`, `BracketLeft`, `BracketRight`, `Backslash`, `Semicolon`, `Quote`, `Comma`, `Period`, `Slash`
- **Lock Keys** â€” `CapsLock`, `ScrollLock`
- **Misc Keys** â€” `ContextMenu`, `Pause`, `PrintScreen`

**Examples:**
```yaml
- pressKey: Enter
- pressKey: Control+KeyA
- pressKey: Shift+Alt+KeyS
- pressKey: ControlOrMeta+KeyC
```

anyOf.title: Scroll Action
anyOf.description: Defines a horizontal or vertical scroll action on the webpage.

scroll.title: Scroll Action
scroll.description: Defines a horizontal or vertical scroll action on the webpage.

speed.description: Speed of the scroll action in pixels per second. Higher values result in faster scrolling. If not specified, defaults to 300 pixels per second.

position.description: Coordinates to scroll to on the webpage. Specify `x` and `y` values representing the horizontal and vertical positions respectively.

x.description: Horizontal position to scroll to on the webpage.

y.description: Vertical position to scroll to on the webpage.

isVisible.title: IsVisible Action
isVisible.description: Defines a visibility check action that verifies whether an element is visible on the page. Can target elements either by CSS selector or by visible text content.

anyOf.markdownDescription:
**Text Content Locator** â€” Direct string  
Checks visibility of elements containing the specified visible text content. Takes the first matching element.

**Usage:** `"Login"`, `"Submit"`, `"padding"`

**Example:**
```yaml
- isVisible: "Get started"  # Check if element with text "Get started" is visible

selector.markdownDescription:
**CSS Selector** â€” `selector:` property  
Uses advanced CSS selector syntax to precisely target elements for visibility checks. Supports Playwright's extended CSS selectors including text matching, visibility filters, and pseudo-classes.

**Standard CSS Selectors:**
```yaml
- isVisible:
    selector: "#login-button"        # Check element by ID
- isVisible:
    selector: ".modal-header"        # Check element by class
- isVisible:
    selector: 'button[type="submit"]' # Check by attribute
```

**Playwright Extended Selectors:**

`:text("...")` â€” Match elements containing specific text
```yaml
- isVisible:
    selector: 'h1:text("Latest Updates")'  # Check h1 with exact text
- isVisible:
    selector: 'button:text("Sign Up")'     # Check button containing text
```

`:has-text("...")` â€” Match elements with substring (case-insensitive)
```yaml
- isVisible:
    selector: 'a:has-text("Get started"):visible'  # Check visible link
- isVisible:
    selector: 'div:has-text("Error")'              # Check div with "Error"
```

`:visible` â€” Filter to only visible elements
```yaml
- isVisible:
    selector: 'button:visible'           # Check if button is visible
- isVisible:
    selector: '.notification:visible'   # Check visible notification
```

`:has()` â€” Match elements containing specific descendants
```yaml
- isVisible:
    selector: 'form:has(input[type="email"])'  # Check form with email input
```

**Combining Selectors:**
```yaml
- isVisible:
    selector: 'a:has-text("Get started"):visible'  # Visible link with text
- isVisible:
    selector: 'div.card:has(h2:text("Title"))'     # Card div with h2 title
```

**Common Use Cases:**
```yaml
# Check if success message appears
- isVisible:
    selector: '.alert-success:visible'

# Verify modal is displayed
- isVisible:
    selector: '#modal:has-text("Confirm")'  

# Check navigation link is visible
- isVisible:
    selector: 'nav a:text("Dashboard"):visible'

# Verify error message
- isVisible: "Error: Invalid credentials"
```

**Learn More:**  
ðŸ“º [Playwright CSS Selectors Guide](https://youtu.be/nN3bS5WJax0?si=GQ7nXW1Te5QvOn7V) â€” Comprehensive tutorial on Playwright's CSS selector capabilities

**Note:** The visibility check will wait for the element to become visible (up to the default timeout) before failing, making it reliable for dynamic content that may take time to appear.
